image.alt: Stang Family Orthodontics team in the office, smiling and welcoming patients

paragraphs.text: Stang Family Orthodontics is a highly rated, family-focused orthodontic practice. Patients note the warm, welcoming team, a clean office, and staff who make treatment fun and comfortable for kids and adults alike.
We offer comprehensive orthodontic care for children, teens, and adults, and we make scheduling simple with an online consultation and appointment request system.

items.title: Top Rated
items.text: Stang Family Orthodontics holds a 5.0 rating with hundreds of patient reviews praising results and the friendly staff.

items.title: Family Friendly
items.text: Patients consistently say the team makes treatment fun and puts children and adults at ease.

items.title: Modern Treatments
items.text: We provide a full range of options, including Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, conventional and clear braces, and lingual solutions for discreet treatment.

items.title: Easy Scheduling
items.text: Convenient office hours and an online appointment/consultation request make getting started quick and simple.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Christine F. Stang, DDS, MSD, is the lead orthodontist at Stang Family Orthodontics. A Virginia native, she earned her Doctor of Dental Surgery degree, summa cum laude, from the Medical College of Virginia and completed an additional two years of postgraduate orthodontic training, earning a Master of Science in Dentistry at the same institution. Dr. Stang focuses on state-of-the-art, personalized care and enjoys building lasting relationships while helping patients achieve confident smiles.

image.alt: Dr. Christine F. Stang, orthodontist at Stang Family Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Dr. Dominique Backus brings genuine care and warmth to every patient interaction. She treats patients with empathy and respect and enjoys family time, reading, volunteering, and staying active outside the office.

image.alt: Dr. Dominique Backus, orthodontist

paragraphs.text: We offer tailored orthodontic solutions from clear aligners to traditional braces, so patients of all ages can find the right treatment.

og_meta.title: Home - Stang Family Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Family-focused orthodontic care in Reston, VA. Personalized treatment for children, teens, and adults with easy online scheduling.

image.alt: Stang Family Orthodontics team standing together in the office lobby

paragraphs.text: We believe orthodontics is about more than teeth — it’s about building long-term relationships, creating confident smiles, and improving quality of life for every patient. Our team combines advanced training, careful diagnosis, and individualized treatment plans to deliver comfortable, efficient care.

We emphasize early evaluation and evidence-based planning to prevent future problems and achieve stable, beautiful results for children, teens, and adults. From clear aligner options to modern bracket systems, we tailor treatment to each person’s needs and lifestyle.

Through gentle techniques, thoughtful communication, and flexible scheduling, we make orthodontic care accessible and convenient. Our goal is that every patient leaves feeling confident, cared for, and proud to share their smile.

image.alt: Dr. Christine Stang smiling, Stang Family Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Dr. Christine F. Stang, DDS, MSD is a board-trained orthodontist dedicated to delivering personalized care and long-lasting results. She discovered her passion for orthodontics after her own braces came off and has built a practice focused on strong patient relationships and excellent outcomes.
Dr. Stang treats children, teens, and adults with the latest orthodontic options, combining careful diagnosis with approaches that emphasize comfort and predictability.

image.alt: Dr. Christine Stang headshot

paragraphs.text: Dr. Stang completed undergraduate studies at James Madison University. She earned her Doctor of Dental Surgery degree, summa cum laude, from the Medical College of Virginia and went on to complete post-graduate orthodontic specialty training and a Master of Science in Dentistry at MCV.

image.alt: Dr. Stang headshot

paragraphs.text: A lifelong Virginian, Dr. Stang lives locally with her husband and two sons. She enjoys walking the lakes in Reston, hiking nearby trails, and giving back through volunteer work with Reston Smile Partners to provide orthodontic care for patients in need.

image.alt: Dr. Stang smiling
Dr. Dominique Backus headshot

paragraphs.text: Dr. Dominique Backus is a dedicated clinician known for treating patients with empathy, respect, and warmth. She prioritizes care delivered the way she would want for her own family and focuses on creating a comfortable experience for every patient.

image.alt: Dr. Dominique Backus headshot

paragraphs.text: Specific degree and certification details for Dr. Backus are available on her full profile. The provided excerpts emphasize her clinical dedication and strong focus on patient-centered care.

image.alt: Dr. Backus headshot

paragraphs.text: Dr. Backus balances professional care with family life. In her free time she enjoys reading, volunteering, tennis, cooking, and hot yoga. She and her family are active in local community events and outreach.

image.alt: Dr. Backus smiling

Get Started.title: What to expect at your first visit

paragraphs.text: Your first visit with Dr. Stang is complimentary. You’ll meet our team, take a quick tour of the office, and we’ll capture diagnostic photos and X-rays. Dr. Stang will perform a thorough exam, listen to your concerns, and explain the treatment options that best fit your smile and lifestyle.

If you decide to move forward, we can often start treatment the same day. To help us make the most of your appointment, please complete the new patient and health history forms before you arrive so we can focus on your care and answer any questions.

image.alt: Orthodontic team greeting a family at the front desk

paragraphs.text: We make paperwork easy. Complete your health history online before your visit so we can personalize your care and keep wait times short. Use the links below to access the new patient packet and to update your medical history.

image.alt: Patient completing orthodontic forms on a tablet
Enjoying Time Together

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at Lakeshore Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Damon System braces use self-ligating brackets that reduce friction and often shorten appointments. They gently guide teeth into alignment using a connected wire that moves teeth gradually and efficiently.

image.alt: Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: Clear aligners are removable, discreet trays that gradually shift teeth with computer-guided precision. We offer Invisalign<sup>®</sup> and Spark options, each designed to fit your lifestyle while letting you eat and clean normally.

image.alt: Close-up of Invisalign aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: Ceramic braces work like traditional braces but use tooth-colored brackets for a more discreet appearance. They offer effective results while blending naturally with your smile.

image.alt: Smiling Woman with Clear Aligner

paragraphs.text: Lingual braces are attached behind the teeth, keeping hardware out of sight. They’re a discreet option for patients who want the control of braces with minimal visibility.

image.alt: Adult patient receiving orthodontic treatment

paragraphs.text: TMJ treatment addresses pain and dysfunction in the jaw joint and surrounding muscles. Our team evaluates jaw movement and recommends conservative therapies or appliances to reduce symptoms and improve function.

image.alt: Modern dentist office interior with advanced technology

paragraphs.text: We provide coordinated care for cleft lip and palate and other dentofacial deformities, working closely with surgical teams to plan interventions that support function, growth, and long-term outcomes.

image.alt: Orthodontic patient receiving orthognathic surgical consultation

paragraphs.text: Custom retainers and appliances help maintain your new smile and support long-term stability. We offer removable and fixed options plus guidance to keep results lasting for years.

image.alt: Beautiful young Asian woman smiling and holding orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: We use ultra low-dose digital x-rays and 3D scanning to get precise diagnostic images while minimizing radiation exposure. These tools improve planning for braces and clear aligner treatment.

image.alt: Digital X-ray equipment showing detailed orthodontic imaging
Enjoying Time Together

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about insurance, timing of care, and patient resources at Backus Braces. For the full list of patient FAQs, visit https://backusbraces.com/patient-resources/orthodontic-faq/.

If you have coverage for orthodontic care, it will help reduce how much you pay out-of-pocket. Many dental insurance policies will cover around 80% to 100% of dental work during a year time period. However, orthodontic insurance is not the same and may cover up to 25% of the cost or up to a specific lifetime max. The degree of coverage will depend on the company. Before your initial appointment, we can determine what the extent of your estimated coverage would be so you know what to expect. We will handle figuring out how much you are covered!

image.alt: Happy Family Portrait

accordion.header: How Soon Should I Get Care?

paragraphs.text: We believe that early intervention is essential in providing patients with successful orthodontic treatment. Your first exam is free, so Dr. Backus can properly diagnose and recommend treatment based on your individual case. The objective of orthodontic care is to intercept and correct any misalignments or other problems as soon as possible. For children, if they do not get the care they need early on then they are at risk of dental or skeletal discrepancy becoming a severe problem. Once we do an examination, we may conclude that the problem is classified as skeletal, dental, an airway obstruction, or damaging habits. In many cases, early treatment can allow time for a solution and prevent a worsened condition.
